entry.title: Where Is Bitcoin Giant Binance Headquartered? Answer Coming ‘In Due Time’
entry.summary: Changpeng Zhao says Binance has offices in cities like Bahrain, Dubai, and Paris, and will soon announce the location of a single global holding company.

entry.title: Bankrupt Three Arrows Capital Owes $3.5B to Creditors, Including $2.3B to Genesis
entry.summary: Over 67% of 3AC’s multibillion-dollar debt is owed to just one creditor.

entry.title: Paraguay One Step Closer To Being a Paradise for Bitcoin Miners
entry.summary: A bill supporting crypto mining in the South American nation now awaits presidential approval.

entry.title: 300+ NFTs Stolen, $400K in Ethereum Taken In Premint Hack
entry.summary: Hackers infiltrated the popular NFT registration platform and used a fake pop-up to coerce users into giving up their wallet information.

entry.title: CryptoPunks Floor Price Tops $100K in Ethereum for First Time in Two Months
entry.summary: Punk prices are on the rise after a pair of multi-million-dollar sales, with the entry-level cost surpassing $100,000 once more.

entry.title: Coinbase and Other Crypto-Exposed Stocks Rally as Bitcoin, Ethereum Rebound
entry.summary: A relief in cryptocurrency prices was good news on Wall Street for these companies.

entry.title: BlockFi Offering Employee Buyouts Just One Month After Cutting Staff by 20%
entry.summary: In an effort to avoid more layoffs while struggling to adjust to market conditions, BlockFi initiated a “voluntary separation program” for employees.

entry.title: Stablecoin Provider Circle Eyes Public Listing in Q4 This Year: CFO
entry.summary: Stablecoin provider Circle still has plans to go public this year regardless of the bearish market conditions, the firm's CFO tells Decrypt.

entry.title: Art Auction House Christie’s Launches Web3 Investment Fund
entry.summary: Called “Christie’s Ventures,” the auction house’s new fund will focus on the intersection of art and finance, among other sectors.

entry.title: Coinbase Cites Bear Market for Suspending Affiliate Program With Influencers: Report
entry.summary: Crypto exchange Coinbase said it was shutting down commissions via its affiliate program for at least the remainder of the year.

entry.title: Snapshot Adds 'Shielded Voting' for DAOs to Help Solve Voter Apathy
entry.summary: The voting-as-a-service platform Snapshot is rolling out a new feature that would let DAO members vote on proposals privately.

entry.title: ApeCoin Surges 22% After Bored Ape Yacht Club Demos Otherside Metaverse
entry.summary: The utility token for the new Bored Ape Yacht Club-inspired metaverse game Otherside is surging after Saturday's "first trip" tech demo.

entry.title: ‘Congress Needs to Act’ on Crypto Says US Senator Elizabeth Warren
entry.summary: The industry's current insolvency issues have prompted Senator Warren to call for a more assertive stance from authorities.

entry.title: Dutch Central Bank Imposes $3.3 Million Fine on Crypto Exchange Binance
entry.summary: The Dutch regulator has fined crypto exchange Binance $3.35 million for offering services without being registered in the Netherlands.

entry.title: ‘Like an Esport’: How OpenSea Secured Its Code With Code4rena’s Audit Contest
entry.summary: With millions of dollars at stake, a conventional code audit wouldn’t cut it for the world’s biggest NFT marketplace, OpenSea. Enter Code4rena.

entry.title: Crypto Market Back Above $1 Trillion as Bitcoin, Ethereum Rebound
entry.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum, the two largest cryptocurrencies, are leading the charge as the broader market rebounded on Monday.

entry.title: Yuga Labs Opens Otherside for ‘First Trips’ in Bored Ape Metaverse
entry.summary: The platform will only be open to owners of Otherside land plots in its first phase.

entry.title: CZ: As ‘Pure Web3 Company,’ Binance Has No Plans to Offer Stock Trading
entry.summary: The CEO said he’s committed to providing Web3 services, and that he’s eyeing potential acquisitions.

entry.title: Avalanche's John Wu: TradFi Interest in Crypto 'Has Absolutely Not Waned'
entry.summary: The president of Ava Labs sees an increased interest in DeFi among institutional investors, and turning assets like bonds into tokens.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: BlockFi and 3AC Try to Clear the Air, CZ Jumps the Gun
entry.summary: Insolvency issues once again dominate the conversation, meanwhile T.J. Miller says buy the dip, and Bill Murray gets himself a Cool Cat.

entry.title: 2 Months of Running With NFT Fitness App Stepn
entry.summary: "Move-to-earn" app Stepn is controversial and flawed—but it's a commendable test case for utility NFTs in the early innings of the space.

entry.title: Where Does Bitcoin Maximalism Go From Here?
entry.summary: The maxi cult is eating itself alive and alienating potential fellow travelers.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Ethereum Bounces Back, Bitcoin Slides, Russia Bans Crypto Payments
entry.summary: In another mostly down week for top cryptocurrencies, Ethereum showed signs of life as The Merge draws near.

entry.title: WeWait: Adam Neumann's Flowcarbon Ebbs
entry.summary: The carbon credit crypto project, which raised $70 million in May, is delaying its token launch.

entry.title: What Immortalizing the 'Curb Your Enthusiasm' Theme Means for Music NFTs
entry.summary: The token was minted in April. An auction is said to be upcoming.

entry.title: How Much Does It Cost to Mine 1 Bitcoin?
entry.summary: JPMorgan strategists may have just called Bitcoin’s bottom price. Others suggest there’s still more pain ahead.

entry.title: How Ethereum Stakers on Lido Finance Are Trading the Merge
entry.summary: DeFi degens are depositing ETH onto Lido Finance in exchange for stETH, in the hopes of redeeming it for more valuable ETH after The Merge.

entry.title: SEC Fines John McAfee’s ICO Partner, Issues Lifetime Ban
entry.summary: A federal judge ruled in the agency's favor while agreeing to dismiss claims against the late former tech mogul.

entry.title: Putin Signs Ban on Crypto Payments in Russia
entry.summary: The drastic move comes after mixed signals from Russia’s leaders and regulators.

entry.title: CryptoPunks NFT Owner Sells for $7 Million Loss—But There’s a Catch
entry.summary: In the world of NFTs, things aren’t always as they seem.

entry.title: Circle Claims USDC Stablecoin Is Now Fully Backed by Cash, US Treasuries
entry.summary: Circle's latest report follows a move from fellow stablecoin issuer Paxos last week to release a detailed breakdown of all assets held in reserve.

entry.title: Who’s Firing—And Still Hiring—During the Bitcoin Bear Market
entry.summary: Some crypto companies are feeling the crunch of a market crash and reducing their employee headcount to cope—but others are still expanding and securing fresh talent. Here's who's hiring and firing in crypto right now.

entry.title: TradFi Lender EquitiesFirst Owes Celsius Nearly Half a Billion Dollars: Report
entry.summary: The ​​Indianapolis-based finance company first started doing business with Celsius in 2019, according to a filing.

entry.title: Three Arrows Capital Liquidators Move to Secure the Company’s Singapore Assets
entry.summary: If Singapore’s High Court approves the liquidator’s requests, Three Arrows Capital may have more assets sold off to creditors.

entry.title: Ethereum Devs Pencil In September Date For Merge
entry.summary: Ethereum's Merge event has a new launch date after network developers laid out a fresh timeline for testnets and updates.

entry.title: Ethereum Jumps 12% as Merge Event Fast Approaches
entry.summary: Investors have pinned high hopes on the upcoming Merge event, with the second-largest cryptocurrency rising double digits this morning.

entry.title: New York Yankees Players, Staff Now Able to Convert Salary Into Bitcoin
entry.summary: Through a new deal with NYDIG, the New York Yankees will now offer employees and players the chance to convert their salaries into Bitcoin.

entry.title: Bitcoin Mixers Are Busier Than Ever in 2022: Chainalysis
entry.summary: The largest address type sending crypto to mixers thos year is cybercriminals and sanctioned nation states, according to Chainalysis.

entry.title: Bitcoin Up, Stocks Down as BTC Correlation to Nasdaq Weakens
entry.summary: Bitcoin's 30-day correlation to tech stocks has fallen again after seeing record-high correlation just before the May crash.

entry.title: See You in Court, Anon: UK Judge Allows Lawsuits via NFT Airdrop
entry.summary: A U.K. court has ruled that individuals and entities can now be served legal documents via NFTs. But the jury's out on the method's efficacy.

entry.title: gm: Binance CEO CZ Talks Bailouts, Regulator Demands, and Simulation Theory
entry.summary: In an extensive conversation with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott, Binance CEO CZ talks global and US regulation, Binance HQ locations, crypto bailouts and how he approaches deals, the sports marketing push by big crypto exchanges and why Binance went slower, and why he believes we live in a simulation.

entry.title: Chelsea Manning Talks Crypto, Privacy, and Security
entry.summary: Chelsea Manning, who gave classified documents regarding the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq to WikiLeaks in 2010, talked to Decrypt's Stacy Elliott about crypto and privacy, decentralization and government, and her work with Nym.

entry.title: Binance CEO CZ on Crypto Bailouts and the Deals He Would Not Do
entry.summary: In an interview for Decrypt's gm podcast, CZ laid out Binance's approach to "bailouts" amid the crypto liquidity crunch, and criticized Alameda's complicated lifeline to Voyager.

entry.title: gm: Senator Cynthia Lummis Is Fighting for Bitcoin
entry.summary: Wyoming Sen. Cynthia Lummis, the "Bitcoin Senator," joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott on the gm podcast to talk about the Lummis-Gillibrand crypto regulation bill, the need for clearer policy on crypto in DC, and converting crypto skeptics—plus her take on the bear market and NFTs. Make sure to subscribe to the podcast.

entry.title: #DecryptLive Covering The Continued Crypto Crash
entry.summary: Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Kate Irwin, Stacy Elliott and Jason Nelson discuss the news and parse through what’s happened and what might happen next.

entry.title: Lolli Bitcoin Shopping App CEO at NFT NYC: NFTs 'Captured the Zeitgeist'
entry.summary: Alex Adelman, CEO of Bitcoin shopping rewards app Lolli, talked to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at NFT NYC about why NFTs have impressed him and why he's "kind of sad" because Bitcoin "should have captured" the cultural moment that Ethereum and NFTs did.

entry.title: NFT NYC: How Dequency Is Using Blockchain to Decentralize Music Usage Rights
entry.summary: Just ahead of a live event during NFT NYC from BeetsDAO and Decrypt, Margaret Link and Keatly Haldeman of Dequency talk to Decrypt EIC Dan Roberts about how their company is using the Algorand blockchain to de-bug the decades-old process of music synchronization rights.

entry.title: The Bill Murray 1,000 NFT Project Reveal Trailer
entry.summary: A first look at actor Bill Murray's upcoming Ethereum NFT project with The Chive and Project Venkman.

entry.title: gm: Meet 'Move to Earn' NFT App Stepn
entry.summary: Stepn is the talk of Crypto Twitter: an app that rewards you in crypto for exercising outdoors. But first you have to buy a pricey sneaker NFT. Stepn CMO Shiti Manghani joined the gm podcast to talk about how the app works, its GST and GMT tokens, Stepn's recent decision regarding China, and why the future for NFTs is utility.
